00017 // -- CLASS DESCRIPTION [BDKPDFWRAPPER] --
00018 //
00019 // This class is the base class for RooFit pdf wrappers.
00020 // It provides holds the pdf pointer and 
00021 // provides the basic accessor methods getPdf(), getArgSet() and generate().
00022 // In addition, utility methods used for the generation of 
00023 // events for simultaneous pdfs are implemented in this base class.
00024 //
00025 #include <ctype.h>
00026 #include <iostream>
00027 using std::cout;
00028 using std::endl;
00029 #include <assert.h>
00030 
00031 #include "TString.h"
00032 #include "RooFitCore/RooAbsPdf.hh"
00033 #include "RooFitCore/RooArgSet.hh"
00034 #include "RooFitCore/RooAbsArg.hh"
00035 #include "RooFitCore/RooAbsCollection.hh"
00036 #include "RooFitCore/RooDataSet.hh"
00037 #include "RooFitCore/RooRandom.hh"
00038 #include "RooFitCore/RooRealVar.hh"
00039 
00040 #include "BToDKTo3piK/BdkPdfAbsBase.hh"

00092                              const char *theDesc) {

00094 //  base initialization

00105 RooAbsPdf* BdkPdfAbsBase::getPdf() {
00106 // 
00107 // public accessor to resulting pdf
00108 //
00109   if (verbose().Contains("g")) {
00110     cout << GetName() << ": getPdf() called." << endl;
00111   }
00112   if ( !getIsValid() ) {
00113     if (verbose().Contains("c")) {
00114       cout << GetName() << ": Calling createPdf()." << endl;
00115     }
00116     deletePdf();
00117     createPdf();
00118   }
00119 
00120   return _thePdf;
00121 }

00123 RooArgSet *BdkPdfAbsBase::getArgSet() {

00125 // public accessor to all parameters + dependents in RooArgSet
00126 //
00127   return getPdf()->getParameters(RooArgSet());
00128 }

00132 // public accessor to one parameter of pdf by name
00133 //

00136 
00137 RooArgSet BdkPdfAbsBase::parameters() {
00138 //
00139 // Returns all the parameters (non-dependents)
00140 //
00141 
00142   RooArgSet deps = dependents();
00143   // Add the full list of all variables:
00144   if (0 != allAnalysisVars()){
00145     deps.add(*allAnalysisVars());
00146   }
00147 
00148   return *(getPdf()->getParameters(&deps));
00149 }
00150 
00151 RooArgSet BdkPdfAbsBase::parametersFree(Bool_t freeOnly) {
00152 //
00153 // Returns only the free (floating) parameters if freeOnly = kTRUE,
00154 // and only the fixed parameters if freeOnly = kFALSE.
00155 //
00156   RooArgSet result;
00157 
00158   RooArgSet allPars = parameters();
00159   TIterator * iter = allPars.createIterator();
00160   RooRealVar * var;
00161   while(0!= (var= (RooRealVar*)iter->Next())) {
00162     if ((freeOnly && !var->isConstant()) ||
00163         (!freeOnly && var->isConstant())) {
00164       result.add(*var);
00165     }
00166   }
00167   delete iter;
00168 
00169   return result;
00170 }

00172 
00173 RooDataSet *BdkPdfAbsBase::generate(Int_t nEvents, RooDataSet* protoData) {
00174 // 
00175 // Generic generate method.  
00176 // Calls RooAbsPdf::generate().
00177 //
00178   RooDataSet * data = 0;
00179   RooArgSet deps = dependents();
00180   if (0 == protoData) {
00181     data = getPdf()->generate(deps, nEvents);
00182   }
00183   else {
00184     data = getPdf()->generate(deps, *protoData, nEvents);
00185   }
00186   
00187   return data;
00188 }

00192 RooAbsArg* BdkPdfAbsBase::findReplace(RooAbsArg& arg, 
00193                                       RooAbsCollection& set) {
00194 //
00195 // Replace arg by argument with the same name ending "xxx.ending"
00196 // from set.
00197 //
00198     RooAbsArg *resArg = 0;
00199     TString name = arg.GetName();
00200     TString suf  = ( name.Contains('.') ? 
00201                      "*"+ name(name.Last('.'),name.Length()-1) : name );
00202     RooAbsCollection* set2 = set.selectByName(suf.Data());
00203 
00204     if ( set2->getSize() > 0 ) {
00205         Bool_t success = kFALSE;
00206         if ( set2->getSize() > 1 ) {
00207             cout << "BdkPdfAbsBase::findReplace: too many matching args!" 
00208                  << endl;
00209             cout << "BdkPdfAbsBase::findReplace: taking first of " 
00210                  << set2->getSize() << " args." << endl;
00211         } 
00212         TIterator *iter = set2->createIterator();
00213         resArg = (RooAbsArg*)iter->Next();
00214         success = kTRUE;
00215         delete iter;
00216         cout << GetName() << ": Link " << arg.GetName() << " --> " ; 
00217         if ( success ) 
00218             cout << resArg->GetName() << " ..."  << " success !" << endl;
00219         else
00220             cout << " ... failed !!!" << endl;
00221     } else {
00222         resArg = &arg;
00224     }
00225     delete set2;
00226     
00227     return resArg;
00228 }

00250 void BdkPdfAbsBase::fixAll(Bool_t val) {
00251 //
00252 // Fix or float all the parameters
00253 //
00254   RooArgSet pars = parameters();
00255   TIterator * iter = pars.createIterator();
00256   RooRealVar * var;
00257   while(0 != (var= (RooRealVar*)iter->Next())) {
00258     // Fix/free the parameter:
00259     var->setConstant(val);
00260     
00261     if (kFALSE == val) {
00262       // Always fix the dummy parameters which are numerical only:
00263       TString theName = var->GetName();
00264       Bool_t numeric = kTRUE;
00265       int numDots = 0;
00266       for (int d = 0; d < theName.Length(); ++d){
00267         if (!isdigit(theName(d))) {
00268           // the character is not a digit. See if it's a dot:
00269           if (theName(d) == '.') {
00270             ++numDots;
00271           }
00272           else {
00273             // otherwise, found a non-digit and non-'.', so not numerical
00274             numeric = kFALSE;
00275             break; 
00276           }
00277         } // end if character is not a digit
00278       } // end loop on characters in theName
00279       if (numDots <= 1 && numeric == kTRUE){
00280         // Only digits or one '.' found. So numerical. Fix it:
00281         cout << "fixAll() fixing numerical parameter " << theName << endl;
00282         var->setConstant();
00283       }
00284     } // end if (kFALSE == val)
00285   } // end while iterating on parameters
00286   delete iter;
00287 }

00289 void BdkPdfAbsBase::setVerbose(const char * val) {
00290   //
00291   // set verbose flag:
00292   // c: Message every time createPdf is called
00293   // i: Informational messages
00294   // d: Message every time object is deleted
00295   // g: Message when getPdf() is called
00296   //
00297   _verbose = val;
00298   _verbose.ToLower();
00299 }
00300 
00301 void BdkPdfAbsBase::setPdf(RooAbsPdf & thePdf, Bool_t owned) {
00302   // Set _thePdf.
00303   // First, clean up the old PDF:
00304   deletePdf();
00305 
00306   // Then assign it to the argument:
00307   _thePdf = &thePdf;
00308   _pdfOwned = owned;
00309 }
00310 
00311 
00312 void BdkPdfAbsBase::deletePdf() {
00313   // Delete _thePdf if it's owned and non-0:
00314   if (kTRUE == _pdfOwned && 0 != _thePdf) {
00315     if (verbose().Contains("d")) {
00316       cout << GetName() << "::deletePdf(): deleting _thePdf." << endl;
00317     }
00318 
00319     delete _thePdf;
00320     
00321     // Since this function can get called not in the destructor, make
00322     // sure that _thePdf is null:
00323     _thePdf = 0;
00324   }
00325 }
